title: Possible Dates Emerge For The Postponed Merseyside Derby
body_text:
The 245th Merseyside Derby was postponed yesterday due to safety concerns surrounding Storm Darragh, which produced winds of over 70 mph.
Possible Dates Emerge For The Postponed Merseyside Derby
A packed football calendar makes rescheduling a match difficult, so we will probably have to wait a few months for Everton and Liverpool to renew hostilities.
The next logical question becomes: when will the match take place?
Two possible dates, the midweek slots currently reserved for Champions League playoff matches to reach the official knockout rounds, the 11th or 12th of February, or the 18th or 19th of February. This, however, is dependent on Liverpool securing an automatic berth in the Round of 16, which currently looks likely. Everton, of course, do not have to concern themselves with the ongoings of European football.
Another date that has been mooted is New Yearâ€™s Day, which would be less desirable for both sides after a busy December.
Zooming out, it would be wonderful if the football calendar was such that matches could be postponed a day or two for whatever reason, and not postponed for months at a time. And also, that possible dates to reschedule matches do not depend on luck that one side or the other does not qualify for one competition or another.
Everton could also feel aggrieved with the postponement, as Liverpool were without several key players due to suspension and injury, which will likely not be the case when the match does finally take place.
Of course, this would require that football governing bodies work together for the benefit of players, fans, and the game, instead of trying to squeeze out a few more quid from their slice of the pie. So this will never happen.
